In Seamonkey 2.0.14, using right-click-copy, I could reliably copy and paste information from various time delayed popups to 'notepad'.  However, this no longer works reliably on Seamonkey 2.2. To see this, do the following:

1. Load "http://www.titantv.com/" and set up the 'Channel Lineup' grid.

2. Click on any program cell to bring up its information popup. The popup has a timer so it will eventually go away if the cursor focus leaves the clicked cell/popup.

3. Move the cursor to the popup and highlight a portion of the text, then try one of two things:

4a. Do a [ctrl-c]--this will copy the highlighted text to the clipboard which can then be pasted into 'notepad'.  This has always worked on 2.0.14 and 2.2. Or

4b. Keeping the cursor on the highlighted text, quickly right click and select copy, then try and paste to 'notepad'.  If you're fast with the right-click-copy, it may work but not usually.  It seemed to always work on 2.0.14 even if the popup timed out and went away before the copy was selected.

I can reproduce this in the following Linux64 trunk build so it is specific to neither Windows nor 32-bit:

UA:"Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:47.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/47.0 SeaMonkey/2.44a1"
ID:20160208023510 en-US
c-c:4a60c0ffe9af0b68a82a6601c121e251863235e5

Selecting text in the popup followed by Ctrl+C moves the text to the X11 clipboard. If instead of Ctrl-C I use Right-click followed by Copy I don't see anything in the clipboard.

N.B. FWIW, HTML tags seem to be improperly nested in the Copy.htm source. The W3C Validator https://validator.w3.org/#validate_by_upload finds a lot of errors and stops at a fatal error.
